H0.text: Photoperiodism regulates the time of flowering in many species.

H1.text: Wind patterns regulate the time of flowering in many species.

H2.text: Spirogyra regulates the time of flowering in many species.

H3.text: Pollenation regulates the time of flowering in many species.

A4.text: Photoperiodism affects flowering by inducing the shoot to produce floral buds instead of leaves and lateral buds.

A5.text: Photoperiodism is the physiological reaction of organisms to the length of light or a dark period.
